verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai during the 1st month of the 2nd year after they had left Egypt. He said,

verses.kjv: Let the children of Israel also keep the passover at his appointed season.
verses.ct: "The Israelites must celebrate the Passover at its designated time.

verses.kjv: In the fourteenth day of this month, at even, ye shall keep it in his appointed season: according to all the rites of it, and according to all the ceremonies thereof, shall ye keep it.
verses.ct: On the 14th day of this month at twilight, you must observe it at its designated time. Follow all its rules and regulations exactly."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake unto the children of Israel, that they should keep the passover.
verses.ct: So Moses told the Israelites to celebrate the Passover.

verses.kjv: And they kept the passover on the fourteenth day of the first month at even in the wilderness of Sinai: according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so did the children of Israel.
verses.ct: They observed the Passover on the 14th day of the 1st month at twilight in the wilderness of Sinai. The Israelites did everything exactly as the LORD had instructed Moses.

verses.kjv: And there were certain men, who were defiled by the dead body of a man, that they could not keep the passover on that day: and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day:
verses.ct: But some men had become ceremonially unclean from contact with a dead body and could not celebrate the Passover on that day. They went to Moses and Aaron that same day

verses.kjv: And those men said unto him, We are defiled by the dead body of a man: wherefore are we kept back, that we may not offer an offering of the LORD in his appointed season among the children of Israel?
verses.ct: and said to him, "We are ceremonially unclean because of contact with a dead body. Why should we be excluded from presenting the LORD's offering at its designated time along with the rest of the Israelites?"

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto them, Stand still, and I will hear what the LORD will command concerning you.
verses.ct: Moses replied, "Wait here while I find out what the LORD commands regarding your situation."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If any man of you or of your posterity shall be unclean by reason of a dead body, or be in a journey afar off, yet he shall keep the passover unto the LORD.
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites: If any of you or your descendants become unclean because of contact with a dead body, or are away on a distant journey, they may still celebrate the Passover to the LORD.

verses.kjv: The fourteenth day of the second month at even they shall keep it, and eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
verses.ct: They must observe it on the 14th day of the 2nd month at twilight. They are to eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.

verses.kjv: They shall leave none of it unto the morning, nor break any bone of it: according to all the ordinances of the passover they shall keep it.
verses.ct: They must not leave any of it until morning, and they must not break any of its bones. They must follow all the regulations of the Passover when they observe it.

verses.kjv: But the man that is clean, and is not in a journey, and forbeareth to keep the passover, even the same soul shall be cut off from among his people: because he brought not the offering of the LORD in his appointed season, that man shall bear his sin.
verses.ct: But anyone who is ceremonially clean and is not on a journey, yet fails to celebrate the Passover — that person must be cut off from their people. Because they did not present the LORD's offering at its designated time, that person will bear the consequences of their sin.

verses.kjv: And if a stranger shall sojourn among you, and will keep the passover unto the LORD; according to the ordinance of the passover, and according to the manner thereof, so shall he do: ye shall have one ordinance, both for the stranger, and for him that was born in the land.
verses.ct: If a foreigner living among you wants to celebrate the Passover to the LORD, they must follow the same rules and regulations of the Passover. There will be one standard for both the foreigner and the native-born."

verses.kjv: And on the day that the tabernacle was reared up the cloud covered the tabernacle, namely, the tent of the testimony: and at even there was upon the tabernacle as it were the appearance of fire, until the morning.
verses.ct: On the day the tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered it — specifically the tent of the testimony. From evening until morning, what appeared to be fire rested over the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: So it was alway: the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.
verses.ct: This was the constant pattern: the cloud covered it during the day, and the appearance of fire covered it at night.

verses.kjv: And when the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle, then after that the children of Israel journeyed: and in the place where the cloud abode, there the children of Israel pitched their tents.
verses.ct: Whenever the cloud lifted from above the tabernacle, the Israelites would break camp and move out. Wherever the cloud settled, the Israelites would set up camp.

verses.kjv: At the commandment of the LORD the children of Israel journeyed, and at the commandment of the LORD they pitched: as long as the cloud abode upon the tabernacle they rested in their tents.
verses.ct: At the LORD's command the Israelites traveled, and at the LORD's command they set up camp. As long as the cloud remained over the tabernacle, they stayed in their camp.

verses.kjv: And when the cloud tarried long upon the tabernacle many days, then the children of Israel kept the charge of the LORD, and journeyed not.
verses.ct: When the cloud stayed over the tabernacle for many days, the Israelites obeyed the LORD's instructions and did not travel.

verses.kjv: And so it was, when the cloud was a few days upon the tabernacle; according to the commandment of the LORD they abode in their tents, and according to the commandment of the LORD they journeyed.
verses.ct: Sometimes the cloud remained over the tabernacle for only a few days. Following the LORD's command they would stay in camp, and following the LORD's command they would move on.

verses.kjv: And so it was, when the cloud abode from even unto the morning, and that the cloud was taken up in the morning, then they journeyed: whether it was by day or by night that the cloud was taken up, they journeyed.
verses.ct: Sometimes the cloud stayed only from evening until morning, and when it lifted in the morning, they traveled. Whether the cloud lifted during the day or during the night, they would break camp and go.

verses.kjv: Or whether it were two days, or a month, or a year, that the cloud tarried upon the tabernacle, remaining thereon, the children of Israel abode in their tents, and journeyed not: but when it was taken up, they journeyed.
verses.ct: Whether it was 2 days, a month, or a year that the cloud lingered over the tabernacle, the Israelites remained in camp and did not travel. But when it lifted, they moved on.

verses.kjv: At the commandment of the LORD they rested in the tents, and at the commandment of the LORD they journeyed: they kept the charge of the LORD, at the commandment of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
verses.ct: At the LORD's command they camped, and at the LORD's command they traveled. They followed the LORD's instructions, given through Moses.
